Class Miranda

java.lang.Object
com.ltsllc.miranda.Miranda
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyListener
public class Miranda extends Object implements PropertyListener

      public static final String PROPERTY_BID_TIMEOUT
      How long the system, in milliseconds, will wait for another node to make a bid

    • PROPERTY_DEFAULT_BID_TIMEOUT

      public static final String PROPERTY_DEFAULT_BID_TIMEOUT
      The default bid timeout to use if the user doesn't specify one. The default is 500msecs.

      public static final String PROPERTY_MESSAGE_PORT
      The TCP port at which the system will listen for messages from a client

    • PROPERTY_DEFAULT_MESSAGE_PORT

      public static final String PROPERTY_DEFAULT_MESSAGE_PORT
      The default TCP port to listen to if the user doesn't specify one. The default is 3030

      • Constant Field Values

    • PROPERTY_CACHE_LOAD_LIMIT

      public static final String PROPERTY_CACHE_LOAD_LIMIT
      The value that is used for the message cache.

      This is the size, in two character bytes, for the message cache.

    • PROPERTY_DEFAULT_CACHE_LOAD_LIMIT

      public static final String PROPERTY_DEFAULT_CACHE_LOAD_LIMIT
      The default size of the message cache. The default is 100Megabytes.
      See Also:

      • Constant Field Values

    • PROPERTY_CLUSTER_1

      public static final String PROPERTY_CLUSTER_1
      The name of the property to look at to decide if clustering is on or off. If the user doesn't supply an alternative value then the system assumes that clustering is off.

    • PROPERTY_CLUSTER_RETRY

      public static final String PROPERTY_CLUSTER_RETRY
      The amount of time, in milliseconds that the system waits after an attempt to contact another node

    • PROPERTY_DEFAULT_CLUSTER_RETRY

      public static final String PROPERTY_DEFAULT_CLUSTER_RETRY
      The default time to wait between calls to another node to see if it's up. The default is 10,000 milliseconds (10 seconds).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PROPERTY_MESSAGE_LOG

      public static final String PROPERTY_MESSAGE_LOG
      The name of the file that the node will log new messages to.

    • PROPERTY_DEFAULT_MESSAGE_LOG

      public static final String PROPERTY_DEFAULT_MESSAGE_LOG
      The default logfile name to use. The default is "messages.log."
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PROPERTY_START_TIMEOUT

      public static final String PROPERTY_START_TIMEOUT
      The timeout (in milliseconds) that miranda will wait for a START_ACKNOWLEDGED message after issuing a START message.

    • PROPERTY_DEFAULT_START_TIMEOUT

      public static final String PROPERTY_DEFAULT_START_TIMEOUT
      The default timeout for a start message (1000 milliseconds).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PROPERTY_UUID

      public static final String PROPERTY_UUID
      The universally unique identifier (UUID) of this node.

      Note that there is no default value for this property the user MUST supply one to avoid system shutdown.

      See Also:

      The time when the node started

    • eldest

      protected long eldest
      What was the time when the oldest node started? This is used when first starting to determine if the node should sync with another node. A value of -1 signifies that we're not currently connected to any other nodes.

    • rld

      protected static io.netty.util.ResourceLeakDetector rld

    • restartIndex

      protected int restartIndex
      where we should pick up

  • Constructor Details

    • Miranda

      public Miranda()
      The constructor for the class

      This sets the static instance to the newly created instance and tries to load the properties for that instance. If there is a problem loading the properties the method throws an UncheckedLtsllcException. It checks for the existence of the myUuid, the myHost and the myPort properties and throws an UncheckedLtsllcException if the property is not defined.

    • setServer

    • mainLoop

      public void mainLoop() throws IOException, com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException
      Miranda's main loop 

       if this iteration is divisible by 1,000
 run garbage collection
 copy all the messages we are responsible for delivering
 foreach of those messages
 try and deliver the message
 if the message was deliver
 remove it from the collection of messages that we are responsible for
 if the message has a status URL
 send a notification that we delivered it

      Note that this is only used if keepRunning is true.

      Throws:
      IOException - If there is a problem copying the messages
      com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException

      Throws:
      IOException
      com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException

    • startUp

      public void startUp(String[] args) throws Exception
      start up miranda

      When Miranda starts up, check for the existence of a sendQueue. If it exists then copy the file and enter the bidding mode.

      Throws:
      Exception

    • deliver

      public void deliver(Message message) throws IOException
      Try to deliver a message

      This method tries to deliver a message asynchronously. On success it calls successfulMessage to signal that this is so.

      Parameters:
      message - The message to
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is a problem with the manipulation of the logfiles

    • successfulMessage

      public void successfulMessage(Message message) throws IOException
      Called when a message has been successfully delivered

      This method calls cluster.informOfDelivery to signal to the cluster that the message has been delivered, removes the message from the send queue and notifying the client that we have delivered the message.

      Parameters:
      message - The message
      Throws:
      IOException

    • notifyClientOfDelivery

      public void notifyClientOfDelivery(Message message)
      Asynchronously tell a client that we delivered their message

      NOTE: this method ignores the state code of the client's response to this POST.

      Parameters:
      message - The message that was delivered

    • parseNodes

      public static void parseNodes()
      Parse out the list of other nodes

      Note that this method assumes that if PROPERTY_CLUSTER + "." <number> + ".host" is defined then the corresponding port is also defined.

      See Also:
      • SpecNode

    • shouldRecover

      public static boolean shouldRecover()
      Should the message log attempt to recover?

      This method is essentially a call to MessageLog.shouldRecover

      Returns:
      Whether the system should recover.

    • recover

      public void recover() throws IOException, com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException
      Attempt to recover from a crash

      This method attempts to recover from a crash by restoring the message and ownership information that the system had when it crashed.

      Throws:
      IOException - If there is a problem reading the files
      com.ltsllc.commons.LtsllcException

      Throws:

    • propertyChanged

      public void propertyChanged(PropertyChangedEvent propertyChangedEvent) throws Throwable

      Specified by:
      propertyChanged in interface PropertyListener
      Parameters:
